meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tenuous.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousnesses of the spider's web made it easy to tear.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousnesses of the thread was evident as it snapped under minimal pressure.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousnesses of the excuse was so flimsy that it fell apart instantly.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousnesses of the relationship was like a delicate glass sculpture, easily shattered.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousnesses of the bridge's structure made crossing it a nerve-wracking experience.

meanings.definition: The thinness or lack of substance in something.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousnesses of the paper made it tear easily.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousnesses of the ice was evident as it cracked under weight.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousnesses of the plot in the movie was so thin, it was almost transparent.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousnesses of the fabric was like trying to hold onto a wisp of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousnesses of the excuse was as thin as a single strand of hair.

meanings.definition: The fragility or delicacy of a situation or argument.
meanings.sent1: The tenuousnesses of the negotiation required careful handling.
meanings.sent2: The tenuousnesses of the glass ornament made it prone to breakage.
meanings.sent3: The tenuousnesses of the plan was so delicate that any disruption could ruin it.
meanings.sent4: The tenuousnesses of the theory was like walking on a tightrope, one misstep could lead to collapse.
meanings.sent5: The tenuousnesses of the situation was like balancing delicate china plates.
